questions.explanation:
Needle & needle.

	Cleopatra's Needle, darning needle, magnetic needle (used on a magnetic compass)

Oil & oil.

	Coconut oil, crude oil, mineral oil etc.

questions.text: Celtic - , double - , George - , Iron - , Maltese - , Southern - .
questions.explanation:
Cross & cross.

	Celtic cross, double cross, George Cross etc.

Card & card.

	Calling card, Christmas card, cigarette card etc.

Art & art.

	Black art (black magic), commercial art, fine art etc. Noble art is boxing.

Fruit & fruit.

	Forbidden fruit, kiwi fruit, passion fruit etc.

questions.text: Bottom - , date - , goal - , main - , Plimsoll - , story - .
questions.explanation:
Line & line.

	Bottom line, date line, firing line etc. Plimsoll line is a load line on a ship named after M.P. Samuel Plimsoll (1824-98)

questions.text: Dark - , river - , rocking - , sea - , Trojan - , Wooden - .
questions.explanation:
Horse & horse.

	Dark horse, river horse (hippopotamus), rocking horse etc. The Trojan Horse is also called the Wooden Horse.

questions.text: Brown - , dress - , sports - , stuffed - , sweat - , tee - .
questions.explanation:
Shirt & shirt.

	Brown Shirt (in Nazi Germany, a storm trooper), dress shirt, sports shirt etc. A stuffed shirt is a pompous or formal person.

Stick & stick.

	Cocktail stick, French stick (French stick loaf), ski stick etc.

Trick & trick.

	Con trick, confidence trick, dirty trick etc. A three-card trick is a game in which players bet on which of the three inverted playing cards is the queen.

Eye & eye.

	Black eye, evil eye, magic eye etc. Private eye or private detective.

Cream & cream.

	Barrier cream, clotted cream, ice cream etc. Vanishing cream is a cosmetic cream that is colourless once applied.

questions.text: Bible - , black - , conveyor - , fan - , Lonsdale - , seat - .
questions.explanation:
Belt & belt.

	Bible Belt, black belt, conveyer belt etc.

questions.text: Hang - , kick - , knock - , mess - , muck - , talk - .
questions.explanation:
About & about & Up & up.

	Hang about, kick about, knock about etc. Muck about is British slang to waste time, misbehave or to interfere with. Apologies to our American players for including this one. 'Up' included as an answer thanks to finlady.

Band & band.

	Big band, brass band, elastic band etc.

Play & play.

	Child's play, miracle play is a medieval play based on a biblical story or the life of a saint, Passion play etc.

Trap & trap.

	Booby trap, poverty trap, radar trap etc.

Gallery & gallery.

	National Gallery, press gallery, public gallery etc.

Hour & hour.

	Happy hour, lunch hour, rush hour etc. Zero hour in military terms is the time set for the start of an attack or the initial stage of an operation.

Chain & chain.

	Bicycle chain, daisy chain, food chain etc.

Lady & lady.

	Bag lady, dinner lady, first lady etc. A painted lady is a variety of butterfly.

Opera & opera.

	Comic opera, grand opera, light opera (operetta) etc.

Face & face.

	Long face, old face (a type style of printing originating in the 18th century), poker face etc.

questions.text: Common - , compound - , partial - , proper - , simple - , vulgar - .
questions.explanation:
Fraction & fraction.

	Common fraction, compound fraction, partial fraction. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
